metadata.title: CVE-2015-5259 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the read_string function in libsvn_ra_svn/marshal.c inApache Subversion 1.9.x before 1.9.3 allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code via an svn:// protocol string, which triggers a heap-basedbuffer overflow and an out-of-bounds read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5259` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2').
